Heinlein.</subfield></datafield><datafield tag="260" ind1=" " ind2=" "><subfield code="a">New York :</subfield><subfield code="b">Scribner,</subfield><subfield code="c">[1958].</subfield></datafield><datafield tag="300" ind1=" " ind2=" "><subfield code="a">276 p. :</subfield><subfield code="b">illus. ;</subfield><subfield code="c">21 cm.</subfield></datafield><datafield tag="520" ind1=" " ind2=" "><subfield code="a">A high school senior wins a space suit in a soap jingle contest, takes a last walk wearing "Oscar" before cashing him in for college tuition, and suddenly finds himself on a space odyssey.</subfield></datafield><datafield tag="650" ind1=" " ind2="0"><subfield code="a">Science fiction, American.</subfield></datafield><datafield tag="949" ind1=" " ind2=" "><subfield code="a">PS3515.E288H38 1958</subfield><subfield code="w">LC</subfield><subfield code="c">1</subfield><subfield code="i">000013122430</subfield><subfield code="d">12/11/2000</subfield><subfield code="e">9/14/1987</subfield><subfield code="l">HATHIETAS</subfield><subfield code="m">UP-SPECCOL</subfield><subfield code="r">Y</subfield><subfield code="s">Y</subfield><subfield code="t">HATHIETAS</subfield><subfield code="u">4/12/2001</subfield></datafield></record>
all_text_timv: Heinlein, Robert A. (Robert Anson), 1907-1988 Have space suit--will travel / by Robert A. Heinlein. New York : Scribner, [1958]. 276 p. : illus. ; 21 cm. A high school senior wins a space suit in a soap jingle contest, takes a last walk wearing "Oscar" before cashing him in for college tuition, and suddenly finds himself on a space odyssey. Science fiction, American.
